Class JobCC

  • java.lang.Object

  • public class JobCC
extends java.lang.Object
    Caching control layer for job objects.

    • Method Detail

      • getAccessesAverted

        public static long getAccessesAverted()
        Retrieves the data accesses averted statistic for this cache.
        Returns:
        the number of data accesses averted because of a cache hit

      • initCache

        public static void initCache()
        Initializes the cache, without a maximum size restriction.

      • initCache

        public static void initCache(long maxSize)
        Initializes the cache, with a maximum size.

      • clearCache

        public static void clearCache()
        Clears the cache.

      • create

        public static long create(long agentId,
                          long adminId,
                          java.util.Date timeAssigned,
                          java.lang.String params,
                          boolean periodic,
                          int period)
                   throws DaoException
        Creates a new job using the data provided and caches it.
        Parameters:
        agentId - id of the agent for which the job is being created.
        adminId - id of the admin that is creating the job.
        timeAssigned - time of job assignment.
        params - job parameters.
        periodic - job's periodic property.
        period - job's period, if periodic.
        Returns:
        the newly created job's id or 0 if the job could not be retrieved for caching after its creation.
        Throws:
        DaoException - if the job could not be created or retrieved for caching.

      • findById

        public static JobDao findById(long jobId)
                       throws DaoException
        Retrieves an existing job with specified id and caches it.
        Parameters:
        jobId - the job's id.
        Returns:
        an object representing the job found, or null if a job with specified id was not found.
        Throws:
        DaoException - if a data access error occurs.

      • findAllWithAgentId

        public static java.util.Set<JobDao> findAllWithAgentId(long agentId)
                                                throws DaoException
        Retrieves all jobs that have been assigned to a specific agent and caches them.
        Parameters:
        agentId - the agent's id.
        Returns:
        a set of objects, each representing a job.
        Throws:
        DaoException - if a data access error occurs.

      • findAllWithAgentId

        public static java.util.Set<JobDao> findAllWithAgentId(long agentId,
                                                       boolean sent)
                                                throws DaoException
        Retrieves all sent or not sent jobs that have been assigned to a specific agent and caches them.
        Parameters:
        agentId - the agent's id.
        sent - the jobs' status, sent or not sent.
        Returns:
        a set of objects, each representing a job.
        Throws:
        DaoException - if a data access error occurs.

      • findAllWithAdminId

        public static java.util.Set<JobDao> findAllWithAdminId(long adminId)
                                                throws DaoException
        Retrieves all jobs that have been assigned by a specific admin and caches them.
        Parameters:
        adminId - the admin's id.
        Returns:
        a set of objects, each representing a job.
        Throws:
        DaoException - if a data access error occurs.

      • setTimeSent

        public static void setTimeSent(long jobId,
                               java.util.Date timeSent)
                        throws DaoException
        Sets a job's sent time to a specific value. If the job was cached, updates the cached instance as well.
        Parameters:
        jobId - the job's id.
        timeSent - the job's sent time.
        Throws:
        DaoException - if the job's sent time could not be set to the specified value or a data access error occurs.

      • setTimeStopped

        public static void setTimeStopped(long jobId,
                                  java.util.Date timeStopped)
                           throws DaoException
        Sets a job's stop time to a specific value. If the job was cached, updates the cached instance as well.
        Parameters:
        jobId - the job's id.
        timeStopped - the job's stop time.
        Throws:
        DaoException - if the job's stop time could not be set to the specified value or a data access error occurs.
